alert.note: Alert for Inland Harris; Northern Liberty; Southern Liberty (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 2:02PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, Liberty, southern Polk and northeastern Harris Counties through 300 PM CST... At 201 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenefick, or 7 miles north of Dayton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Liberty, Dayton, Ames, Daisetta, Hardin, Plum Grove, Kenefick, Dayton Lakes, Tarkington Prairie, Moss Hill, Romayor and Rye. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Brief and weak tornadoes possible.

area.areaDesc: Inland Harris; Northern Liberty; Southern Liberty
